title: The Brilliance and Weirdness of ChatGPT
description: A new chatbot from OpenAI is inspiring awe, fear, stunts and attempts to circumvent its guardrails.

title: Detective Sued Over SWAT Raid Based on Wrong Location on the Find My App
description: A detective relied on flawed information provided by the Find My app for a warrant that led the police to raid the home of a 77-year-old Denver woman, a lawsuit says.

title: Slack C.E.O. Stewart Butterfield to Step Down in January
description: Stewart Butterfield, the chief executive of Slack, which is owned by Salesforce, is the latest to announce an exit from Salesforce in recent weeks.

title: Slack CEO Stewart Butterfield to Leave Salesforce in January
description: Stewart Butterfield, the chief executive of Slack, which is owned by Salesforce, is the latest to announce an exit from Salesforce in recent weeks.

title: Video Game Workers at Microsoft and Activision Take Steps to Unionize
description: A union is testing Microsoft’s pledge to remain neutral on an organizing bid as the Xbox maker seeks regulatory approval for its Activision acquisition.

title: TikTok Influencer Is Fined After Hitting a Golf Ball Into the Grand Canyon
description: Katie Sigmond, who has nearly seven million followers on TikTok and posts workout and modeling videos, faced legal trouble after the stunt.

title: The Crypto Industry Struggles for a Way Forward After FTX Collapse
description: The implosion of the exchange FTX shows how an industry built in the wake of the 2008 financial crisis has drifted far from its original ideals.

title: Elon Musk and Matt Taibbi Set Off Debate Over Release of Twitter Files
description: A release of internal documents from Twitter set off intense debates in the intersecting worlds of media, politics and tech.
